thread.title: Doll Asylum a haunting Halloween experience in North Portland
thread.title_full: Doll Asylum a haunting Halloween experience in North Portland | OregonLive.com

author: Beth Nakamura | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Doll Asylum a haunting Halloween experience in North Portland
text:
It holds more than 1,000 dolls, over twenty vignettes and more creepiness than ought to be legal.
Welcome to the Doll Asylum , a makeshift doll-themed museum that opens its doors for a limited time and beginning this weekend.
The annual Halloween experience is the brainchild of Mark Williams and Heidi Loutzenhiser, a North Portland couple who started the Doll Asylum when they moved into the Piedmont neighborhood over six years ago.
"The first year we did it, we thought it would be a good way to meet the neighbors," Loutzenhiser said.
The couple first thought a bird theme might work, but when Mark Williams made an early morning airport run, he noticed a oversized doll leaning against a tree as he pulled his car out. It was 4 a.m. and foggy. In that moment, the idea for the asylum was hatched.
"Dolls are perfect," Williams said. "Because they're cheap. And they creep people out."
"All of these are donated or bought from Goodwill or other thrift shops," he said.
All, that is, but the first seventy-five. Those were left to Loutzenhiser when her mother died.
Through the years people who've toured the house have discreetly placed dolls in the displays, adding to the collection.
"And they come and see them every year," Williams said.
-- Beth Nakamura 503-221-8218
Twitter: @bethnakamura
Instagram: @bethnakamura
The Doll Asylum is free and open to the public. Hours are 5 p.m. to 9 p.m. Friday through Sunday, October 23-25 and October 30-31. dollasylum.com
